Homework (due 0320)

Complete these for Wednesday, March 20. Show work that justifies your answers for full credit.

  1. Give in component form the vector represented by the directed line segment \(\overrightarrow{AB}\):

    1. \(A=(4,3)\) and \(B=(-2,1)\)

      The vector components are computed as follows: \(\langle -2-4,1-3\rangle\), which simplifies to \(\langle -6,-2\rangle.\)

    2. \(A=(2,5)\) and \(B=(0,1)\)

      The vector components are computed as follows: \(\langle 0-2,1-5\rangle\), which simplifies to \(\langle -2,-4\rangle.\)

    3. \(A=(-2,4)\) and \(B=(0,4)\)

      The vector components are computed as follows: \(\langle 0--2,4-4\rangle\), which simplifies to \(\langle 2,0\rangle.\)

    4. \(A=(3,2)\) and \(B=(3,-5)\)

      The vector components are computed as follows: \(\langle 3-3,-5-2\rangle\), which simplifies to \(\langle -7,0\rangle.\)

  2. Give the magnitude, direction angle, and unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{v}.\) Give approximate answers rounded to a reasonable number of decimal places:

    1. \(\overrightarrow{v}=\langle 2,4\rangle\)

      The magnitude is \(\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert=\sqrt{(2)^2+(4)^2}=\sqrt{20}\approx 4.47.\) This vector's direction angle is between \(0^\circ\) and \(90^\circ\), and so the direction angle is \(\tan^{-1}(\frac{4}{2})\approx 63^\circ.\) The unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{v}\) is \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}}{\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert}=\frac{\langle 2,4\rangle}{\sqrt{20}}=\langle \frac{2}{\sqrt{20}},\frac{4}{\sqrt{20}}\rangle\approx \langle 0.45,0.89\rangle.\)

    2. \(\overrightarrow{v}=\langle -3,1\rangle\)

      The magnitude is \(\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert=\sqrt{(-3)^2+(1)^2}=\sqrt{10}\approx 3.16.\) This vector's direction angle is between \(90^\circ\) and \(180^\circ\), and so the direction angle is \(\tan^{-1}(\frac{1}{-3})+180^\circ\approx 162^\circ.\) The unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{v}\) is \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}}{\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert}=\frac{\langle -3,1\rangle}{\sqrt{10}}=\langle -\frac{3}{\sqrt{10}},\frac{1}{\sqrt{10}}\rangle\approx \langle -0.95,0.32\rangle.\)

    3. \(\overrightarrow{v}=\langle 0,3\rangle\)

      The magnitude is \(\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert=\sqrt{(0)^2+(3)^2}=3.\) This vector's direction angle is \(90^\circ.\) The unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{v}\) is \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}}{\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert}=\frac{\langle 0,3\rangle}{3}=\langle 0,1\rangle.\)

    4. \(\overrightarrow{v}=\langle -2,0\rangle\)

      The magnitude is \(\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert=\sqrt{(-2)^2+(0)^2}=2.\) This vector's direction angle is \(180^\circ.\) The unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{v}\) is \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}}{\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert}=\frac{\langle -2,0\rangle}{2}=\langle -1,0\rangle.\)

    5. \(\overrightarrow{v}=\langle 4,-3\rangle\)

      The magnitude is \(\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert=\sqrt{(4)^2+(-3)^2}=5.\) This vector's direction angle is between \(270^\circ\) and \(360^\circ\), and so the direction angle is \(\tan^{-1}(\frac{-3}{4})+360^\circ\approx 323^\circ.\) The unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{v}\) is \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}}{\Vert\overrightarrow{v}\Vert}=\frac{\langle 4,-3\rangle}{5}=\langle \frac{4}{5},-\frac{3}{5}\rangle=\langle 0.8,-0.6\rangle.\)

  3. Suppose \(\overrightarrow{v}=\langle 2,3\rangle\) and \(\overrightarrow{u}=\langle -1,4\rangle.\) Use component arithmetic to perform the following computations:

    1. \(3\overrightarrow{v}=3\cdot\langle 2,3\rangle=\langle 6,9\rangle.\)

    2. \(\overrightarrow{v}+\overrightarrow{u}=\langle 2,3\rangle+\langle -1,4\rangle=\langle 1,7\rangle.\)

    3. \(\overrightarrow{v}-\overrightarrow{u}=\langle 2,3\rangle-\langle -1,4\rangle=\langle 3,-1\rangle.\)

    4. \(2\overrightarrow{v}+3\overrightarrow{u}=2\langle 2,3\rangle+3\langle -1,4\rangle=\langle(2)(2)+(3)(-1),(2)(3)+(3)(4)\rangle=\langle 1,18\rangle.\)

    5. \(3\overrightarrow{v}-2\overrightarrow{u}=3\langle 2,3\rangle-2\langle -1,4\rangle=\langle(3)(2)-(2)(-1),(3)(3)-(2)(4)\rangle=\langle 8,1\rangle.\)

    6. \(3(\overrightarrow{v}-\overrightarrow{u})=3\cdot\langle 3,-1\rangle=\langle 9,-3\rangle.\)

    7. \(\lVert\overrightarrow{v}\rVert+\lVert\overrightarrow{u}\rVert=\sqrt{(2)^2+(3)^2}+\sqrt{(-1)^2+(4)^2}=\sqrt{13}+\sqrt{15}.\)

    8. \(\lVert\overrightarrow{v}+\overrightarrow{u}\rVert=\Vert\langle 1,7\rangle\Vert=\sqrt{(1)^2+(7)^2}=\sqrt{50}.\)

    9. \(\frac{\lVert\overrightarrow{v}\rVert}{2}=\frac{\sqrt{13}}{2}.\)

    10. \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}+\overrightarrow{u}}{2}=\frac{\langle 1,7\rangle}{2}=\langle\frac{1}{2},\frac{7}{2}\rangle.\)

    11. \(\frac{\lVert\overrightarrow{v}\rVert+\lVert\overrightarrow{u}\rVert}{2}=\frac{\sqrt{13}+\sqrt{15}}{2}.\)

    12. \(\frac{\lVert\overrightarrow{v}+\overrightarrow{u}\rVert}{2}=\frac{\sqrt{50}}{2}.\)

    13. \(\frac{\overrightarrow{v}}{\lVert\overrightarrow{v}\rVert}=\frac{\langle 2,3\rangle}{\sqrt{13}}=\langle \frac{2}{\sqrt{13}},\frac{3}{\sqrt{13}}\rangle.\)
